column8: text

Petrol prices down, diesel unchangedPETALING JAYA: Petrol prices are down for the fourth week of June, while diesel prices stay the same.RON95 is down by seven sen from RM1.98 per litre to RM1.91, the price of RON97 is down by seven sen from RM2.24 per litre to RM2.17 per litre and the price of diesel remains unchanged at RM1.88 per litreThe new prices will be in effect starting June 22 until June 28.The prices were announced on RTM1 and posted on the Domestic Trade, Cooperatives and Consumerism Ministry's Twitter account on Wednesday evening.The weekly fuel pricing mechanism came into effect in April this year.Prices of petrol and diesel had been placed on a managed monthly float system since Dec 1 2014 following the removal of fuel subsidies.petrol station sure crying this time

Wow how stupid are you. Yeah, the fuel subsidy has been removed but that isn't the point now is it? Now we follow crude oil market price....and price has been dropping over the last few weeks, so obviously price in Msia is also dropping every week. But the idiots here like you are saying the recent drop is because of election lah Najib lah Raya lah for f**ks sake grow up. I agree the gov is a corrupt POS but facts are facts, get educated on what's really going on.

They have their own formula on how to calculate fuel price based on crude cost and currency exchange. You think they can get away from inconsistent calculation? Maybe they devised the formula to make extra profit from the people - ok, again....NOT the point!My point is only that the fuel price has been decreasing because it SHOULD be decreasing due to global impact. It's not because of elections or raya or whatever bullshit. If the crude price has been increasing these few weeks, you can bet the price here would be increasing as well.Take off your blinders and stick to the point. Yes, we all know gov is corrupt and they are stealing a lot of money from everyone and creating racial wars, bla bla bla - but the point HERE is fuel price in Msia is dependent on crude price. Full stop.
